CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1945, p. 1, reads: "A Candidate Votes - Mr. and Mrs. Charles P. Pernell arrived early at their polling place in Wandless Street Fire Engine House and cast their votes.  Naturally, they voted for the same candidate for council that 16,000 other voters did.  Mr. Pernell ran seventh in a field of nine candidates in the city-wide election, but carried the Negro districts overwhelmingly. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Pernell depositing vote into ballot box, and Pittsburgh City Council candidate Charles P. Pernell exiting voting booth at polling place in Engine House 26, Wandless Street, Hill District
